newsitem.title: USA: NationsBank near deal to buy Montgomery - report.
newsitem.headline: NationsBank near deal to buy Montgomery - report.

text.p: NationsBank Corp. is close to announcing it will buy investment bank Montgomery Securities Inc. for around $1 billion, financial cable television channel CNBC reported Thursday.

A spokeswoman for San Francisco-based Montgomery declined to comment on the report or whether an agreement had been reached. But she said the company has made no secret of its plans to find a buyer over the past two months.
She said Montgomery Chairman Thom Weisel has expressed an interest in selling a stake and added the closely held company has held negotiations with several banks.

"He's basically said the business is moving towards one-stop shopping and we need a partner to give us the financial resources to grow the business and one who can strategically help the business," the spokeswoman said.
Officials at Charlotte, N.C.-based NationsBank declined to comment on the report.
A merger between the companies would be the latest in a trend of combinations between commercial banks and brokerage houses.
Earlier this month, BankAmerica Corp. announced it would buy investment bank Robertson Stephens & Co., another San Francisco investment bank, for about $540 million.
In April, Bankers Trust New York Corp. agreed to buy Alex Brown & Sons Inc. for $1.7 billion. A month later, Swiss Bank Corp. agreed to buy Dillon Read & Co. for $600 million.
The wave of mergers was sparked by a recent easing of Federal Reserve restrictions on commercial banks' ability to engage in brokerage activities.
Montgomery specializes in high-technology firms. The brokerage had 1996 revenues of $705 million.
NationsBank stock fell $1 to $66.625 in consolidated trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
